title: Hello!
text:
I am a data scientist, small business owner, and lifelong learner. My consultancy, Redgranite Group, develops data products and insights for small-to-medium sized businesses. I work well in interdisciplinary teams, previous colleagues include: psychologists, computer scientists, music theorists, genomicists, software engineers, and educators. I have strong opinions about R, Bayesian statistics, jazz, and GTD.






Actively Looking for Longer-Term Work





I spent the last year working on freelance/consultancy projects (during move from Europe to USA) and I’m now looking for more stable, longer-term work (e.g. full-time, long-contract).
If you’re looking to hire someone with a strong foundation in the bread-and-butter data workflow (wrangling, visualising, modelling, communicating), get in touch!



Links

Redgranite Group

Background

2024-Now : Data Scientist, Director of Redgranite Group
2022-2024: Postdoc at the Music Cognition Group at the University of Amsterdam
2021-2022: Postdoc in the Department of Psychology at Goldsmiths
2020-2021: Senior Research Associate in the Computing Department at Goldsmiths
2019-2020: Lead Instructor of Data Science at Flatiron School in London, England
2015-2019: PhD student at Louisiana State University; Thesis
2014-2015: Research Assistant on an AHRC funded project.
2013-2014: MSc student in the Music, Mind and Brain programme at Goldsmiths
2012-2013: Musician and bartender for weddings at a WWII themed restaurant
2008-2012: Music student at Baldwin Wallace Conservatory of Music
I grew up in Wisconsin.

Recent Talks

How Building a MicroSaas in R might make you a better data scientist @ Northeast Tableau User Group
Characterizing musicality and individual differences within and across societies using engaging games: A Case Study Using the Matching Pairs Paradigm @ Goldsmiths University of London
Musical Memory Experiments for Everyone (including Experts!) @ University of Cambridge

title: Redgranite Group
text:
Redgranite Group creates data products, insights, and solutions for small-to-medium sized organizations.
Beyond our standard data science work, we also offer expert services related to music cognition, audio branding, and assessing and teaching adult learners on technical topics.

Projects and Clients

Dashboard for a client doing high six figure MRR

Developed bespoke expansion and churn metrics
Allowed client to identify at-risk customers
Created R package and Quarto reporting

Report of revenue flow on sales team for rapidly growing tech company

Analyzed financial performance of team relative to spending
One time analysis to assist stakeholders




Products

Bolero: Revenue/Ticket Dashboard for Arts Organizations
DB990: Searchable Database of 990 Tax Returns (Coming Soon…)



Expert Services
Beyond my work in data science, I am an expert in music perception and cognition (former life as academic). I have also worked extensively both delivering technical training and assessing adult learners in data science. Below are a few clients and projects that I’ve worked on because of this expertise.

Audio Branding

Designed scientific studies with MassiveMusic for GSK
Expert for internal Panasonic project
Scientist on Music for Brainwaves project
Assisted with development of Soundout’s original Brand Match tool



Assessing Adult Learners on Technical Topics

I’ve assessed over 80 Master’s level machine learning capstone projects for DSW
Developed internal marking criteria in accordance with UK Government Standard
